title: Construct one or more neuroglancer annotation layers — ngl_annotation_layers
text: supply dataframe ann argument can   columns called point position pt_position   define position. contain x,y,z coordinates formatted   character vector (xyzmatrix2str) list   numeric vectors (xyzmatrix2list). layer optionally name layer point col optionally specify color point. root_id optionally specify supervoxel id point maps onto supervoxel_id optionally specify supervoxel id point maps onto Neuroglancer allows one colour per annotation layer, specify   col layer must consistent. Neuroglancer annotations specified raw coordinates. Although   function can try convert nm coordinates raw, work   points brain space defined current fafb segmentation (see   choose_segmentation). reason used   rawcoords=FALSE convert coordinates working   brain spaces.

title: Construct one or more neuroglancer annotation layers — ngl_annotation_layers
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ## as an example label proofread neurons by institution psp=flywire_cave_query('proofreading_status_public_v1') fwusers=googlesheets4::read_sheet('1G0zqA5DTrfd-a2LuebV4kcqNfl4q1ehlzHBrwT6ZMoc') psp2=dplyr::left_join(psp, fwusers, by=c("user_id"="id")) psp2$layer=psp2$institution # sample 3000 neurons to be a more manageable as an example. psp2s=dplyr::slice_sample(psp2, n=3000) %>%   dplyr::filter(!is.na(layer)) # the layers will be rainbow coloured al=ngl_annotation_layers(psp2s[c("pt_position", "layer")], colpal=rainbow) # make a blank scene sc=ngl_blank_scene() # or decode a URL that you've copied from your browser sc=ngl_decode_scene(clipr::read_clip()) # and the add your annotations as new layer(s) to that scene sc2=sc+al # and make a URL u=as.character(sc2) # and copy that to clipboard clipr::write_clip(u) # ... or open directly in your browser browseURL(u) # It is a good idea to shorten when there are many annotations. # This will load much faster in the browser and be easier to work with su=flywire_shortenurl(u) browseURL(su) } # }

code: # blank scene for current segmentation ngl_blank_scene() #> neuroglancer scene with 2 layers and 0 segments (of which 0 shown) #>                                 name                    type visible nsegs #> 1                   Production-image                   image    TRUE     0 #> 2 Production-segmentation_with_graph segmentation_with_graph    TRUE     0 #>   nhidden #> 1       0 #> 2       0 #>                                                                        source #> 1 precomputed://gs://microns-seunglab/drosophila_v0/alignment/image_rechunked #> 2          graphene://https://prod.flywire-daf.com/segmentation/table/fly_v31 # add a specific id ngl_blank_scene()+"720575940623755722" #> neuroglancer scene with 2 layers and 1 segments (of which 1 shown) #>                                 name                    type visible nsegs #> 1                   Production-image                   image    TRUE     0 #> 2 Production-segmentation_with_graph segmentation_with_graph    TRUE     1 #>   nhidden #> 1       0 #> 2       0 #>                                                                        source #> 1 precomputed://gs://microns-seunglab/drosophila_v0/alignment/image_rechunked #> 2          graphene://https://prod.flywire-daf.com/segmentation/table/fly_v31 # a different segmentation ngl_blank_scene("202004") #> neuroglancer scene with 2 layers and 0 segments (of which 0 shown) #>                 name         type visible nsegs nhidden #> 1     fafb_v14_clahe        image    TRUE     0       0 #> 2 fafb-ffn1-20200412 segmentation    TRUE     0       0 #>                                                              source #> 1 precomputed://gs://neuroglancer-fafb-data/fafb_v14/fafb_v14_clahe #> 2                precomputed://gs://fafb-ffn1-20200412/segmentation u=ngl_blank_scene("202004", return.url=TRUE) if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ u=ngl_blank_scene("sandbox") browseURL(u) } # }

text: R list additional class ngscene describing scene,   , return.json=TRUE, character vector.

title: Decode and manipulate Neuroglancer scenes (from URLs or JSON blocks) — ngl_decode_scene
code: # \donttest{ # get sample FlyWire URL fw_url=with_segmentation('flywire31', getOption('fafbseg.sampleurl')) # only a 0 (dummy) segment id present ngl_segments(fw_url) #> [1] "0" # fw_sc=ngl_decode_scene(fw_url) fw_sc #> neuroglancer scene with 2 layers and 1 segments (of which 1 shown) #>                                 name                    type visible nsegs #> 1                   Production-image                   image    TRUE     0 #> 2 Production-segmentation_with_graph segmentation_with_graph    TRUE     1 #>   nhidden #> 1       0 #> 2       0 #>                                                                        source #> 1 precomputed://gs://microns-seunglab/drosophila_v0/alignment/image_rechunked #> 2          graphene://https://prod.flywire-daf.com/segmentation/table/fly_v31 # add two segments fw_sc=fw_sc+c("720575940621039145", "720575940626877799") ngl_segments(fw_sc) #> [1] "0"                  "720575940621039145" "720575940626877799" # remove that 0 segment fw_sc=fw_sc-0 ngl_segments(fw_sc) #> [1] "720575940621039145" "720575940626877799" # repeated segments are ignored i.e. no duplicates ngl_segments(fw_sc+"720575940621039145") #> [1] "720575940621039145" "720575940626877799" # convert back to a URL, nb this depends on choose_segmentation ngl_encode_url(fw_sc) #> [1] "https://ngl.flywire.ai/#!%7B%22layers%22%3A%5B%7B%22source%22%3A%22precomputed%3A%2F%2Fgs%3A%2F%2Fmicrons-seunglab%2Fdrosophila_v0%2Falignment%2Fimage_rechunked%22%2C%22type%22%3A%22image%22%2C%22blend%22%3A%22default%22%2C%22shaderControls%22%3A%7B%7D%2C%22name%22%3A%22Production-image%22%7D%2C%7B%22source%22%3A%22graphene%3A%2F%2Fhttps%3A%2F%2Fprod.flywire-daf.com%2Fsegmentation%2Ftable%2Ffly_v31%22%2C%22type%22%3A%22segmentation_with_graph%22%2C%22segments%22%3A%5B%22720575940621039145%22%2C%22720575940626877799%22%5D%2C%22skeletonRendering%22%3A%7B%22mode2d%22%3A%22lines_and_points%22%2C%22mode3d%22%3A%22lines%22%7D%2C%22graphOperationMarker%22%3A%5B%7B%22annotations%22%3A%5B%5D%2C%22tags%22%3A%5B%5D%7D%2C%7B%22annotations%22%3A%5B%5D%2C%22tags%22%3A%5B%5D%7D%5D%2C%22pathFinder%22%3A%7B%22color%22%3A%22%23ffff00%22%2C%22pathObject%22%3A%7B%22annotationPath%22%3A%7B%22annotations%22%3A%5B%5D%2C%22tags%22%3A%5B%5D%7D%2C%22hasPath%22%3Afalse%7D%7D%2C%22name%22%3A%22Production-segmentation_with_graph%22%7D%5D%2C%22navigation%22%3A%7B%22pose%22%3A%7B%22position%22%3A%7B%22voxelSize%22%3A%5B4%2C4%2C40%5D%2C%22voxelCoordinates%22%3A%5B108360%2C42086%2C3279%5D%7D%7D%2C%22zoomFactor%22%3A8%7D%2C%22perspectiveZoom%22%3A2230.6094%2C%22jsonStateServer%22%3A%22https%3A%2F%2Fglobalv1.flywire-daf.com%2Fnglstate%2Fpost%22%2C%22selectedLayer%22%3A%7B%22layer%22%3A%22Production-segmentation_with_graph%22%2C%22visible%22%3Atrue%7D%2C%22layout%22%3A%22xy-3d%22%7D"  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # open in your default browser browseURL(ngl_encode_url(fw_sc)) } # } # }  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ngl_decode_scene("<someneuroglancerurl>")  # decode scene from URL currently on clipboard scene=ngl_decode_scene(clipr::read_clip())  # open a Neuroglancer URL in CATMAID ngu="<someurl>" library(elmr) open_fafb(ngl_decode_scene(ngu)) # Or store the URL rather than opening it cmu=open_fafb(ngl_decode_scene(ngu), open=FALSE) } # }

code: # \donttest{ # get sample FlyWire URL fw_url=with_segmentation('flywire31', getOption('fafbseg.sampleurl')) # only a 0 (dummy) segment id present ngl_segments(fw_url) #> [1] "0" # fw_sc=ngl_decode_scene(fw_url) # add a segment fw_sc$layers[[2]]$segments=union(fw_sc$layers[[2]]$segments,   "720575940626877799") # convert back to a URL, nb this depends on choose_segmentation ngl_encode_url(fw_sc) #> [1] "https://ngl.flywire.ai/#!%7B%22layers%22%3A%5B%7B%22source%22%3A%22precomputed%3A%2F%2Fgs%3A%2F%2Fmicrons-seunglab%2Fdrosophila_v0%2Falignment%2Fimage_rechunked%22%2C%22type%22%3A%22image%22%2C%22blend%22%3A%22default%22%2C%22shaderControls%22%3A%7B%7D%2C%22name%22%3A%22Production-image%22%7D%2C%7B%22source%22%3A%22graphene%3A%2F%2Fhttps%3A%2F%2Fprod.flywire-daf.com%2Fsegmentation%2Ftable%2Ffly_v31%22%2C%22type%22%3A%22segmentation_with_graph%22%2C%22segments%22%3A%5B%220%22%2C%22720575940626877799%22%5D%2C%22skeletonRendering%22%3A%7B%22mode2d%22%3A%22lines_and_points%22%2C%22mode3d%22%3A%22lines%22%7D%2C%22graphOperationMarker%22%3A%5B%7B%22annotations%22%3A%5B%5D%2C%22tags%22%3A%5B%5D%7D%2C%7B%22annotations%22%3A%5B%5D%2C%22tags%22%3A%5B%5D%7D%5D%2C%22pathFinder%22%3A%7B%22color%22%3A%22%23ffff00%22%2C%22pathObject%22%3A%7B%22annotationPath%22%3A%7B%22annotations%22%3A%5B%5D%2C%22tags%22%3A%5B%5D%7D%2C%22hasPath%22%3Afalse%7D%7D%2C%22name%22%3A%22Production-segmentation_with_graph%22%7D%5D%2C%22navigation%22%3A%7B%22pose%22%3A%7B%22position%22%3A%7B%22voxelSize%22%3A%5B4%2C4%2C40%5D%2C%22voxelCoordinates%22%3A%5B108360%2C42086%2C3279%5D%7D%7D%2C%22zoomFactor%22%3A8%7D%2C%22perspectiveZoom%22%3A2230.6094%2C%22jsonStateServer%22%3A%22https%3A%2F%2Fglobalv1.flywire-daf.com%2Fnglstate%2Fpost%22%2C%22selectedLayer%22%3A%7B%22layer%22%3A%22Production-segmentation_with_graph%22%2C%22visible%22%3Atrue%7D%2C%22layout%22%3A%22xy-3d%22%7D" # another way to do this, which long time R users may find more intuitive as.character(fw_sc) #> [1] "https://ngl.flywire.ai/#!%7B%22layers%22%3A%5B%7B%22source%22%3A%22precomputed%3A%2F%2Fgs%3A%2F%2Fmicrons-seunglab%2Fdrosophila_v0%2Falignment%2Fimage_rechunked%22%2C%22type%22%3A%22image%22%2C%22blend%22%3A%22default%22%2C%22shaderControls%22%3A%7B%7D%2C%22name%22%3A%22Production-image%22%7D%2C%7B%22source%22%3A%22graphene%3A%2F%2Fhttps%3A%2F%2Fprod.flywire-daf.com%2Fsegmentation%2Ftable%2Ffly_v31%22%2C%22type%22%3A%22segmentation_with_graph%22%2C%22segments%22%3A%5B%220%22%2C%22720575940626877799%22%5D%2C%22skeletonRendering%22%3A%7B%22mode2d%22%3A%22lines_and_points%22%2C%22mode3d%22%3A%22lines%22%7D%2C%22graphOperationMarker%22%3A%5B%7B%22annotations%22%3A%5B%5D%2C%22tags%22%3A%5B%5D%7D%2C%7B%22annotations%22%3A%5B%5D%2C%22tags%22%3A%5B%5D%7D%5D%2C%22pathFinder%22%3A%7B%22color%22%3A%22%23ffff00%22%2C%22pathObject%22%3A%7B%22annotationPath%22%3A%7B%22annotations%22%3A%5B%5D%2C%22tags%22%3A%5B%5D%7D%2C%22hasPath%22%3Afalse%7D%7D%2C%22name%22%3A%22Production-segmentation_with_graph%22%7D%5D%2C%22navigation%22%3A%7B%22pose%22%3A%7B%22position%22%3A%7B%22voxelSize%22%3A%5B4%2C4%2C40%5D%2C%22voxelCoordinates%22%3A%5B108360%2C42086%2C3279%5D%7D%7D%2C%22zoomFactor%22%3A8%7D%2C%22perspectiveZoom%22%3A2230.6094%2C%22jsonStateServer%22%3A%22https%3A%2F%2Fglobalv1.flywire-daf.com%2Fnglstate%2Fpost%22%2C%22selectedLayer%22%3A%7B%22layer%22%3A%22Production-segmentation_with_graph%22%2C%22visible%22%3Atrue%7D%2C%22layout%22%3A%22xy-3d%22%7D"  if (FALSE) { # ..$ type                : chr "segmentation_with_graph" #>   ..$ segments            : chr [1:2] "720575940621039145" "720575940626877799" #>   ..$ skeletonRendering   :List of 2 #>   .. ..$ mode2d: chr "lines_and_points" #>   .. ..$ mode3d: chr "lines" #>   ..$ graphOperationMarker:List of 2 #>   .. ..$ :List of 2 #>   .. .. ..$ annotations: list() #>   .. .. ..$ tags       : list() #>   .. ..$ .. ..$ annotationPath:List of 2 #>   .. .. .. ..$ annotations: list() #>   .. .. .. ..$ tags       : list() #>   .. .. ..$ hasPath       : logi FALSE #>   ..$ name                : chr "Production-segmentation_with_graph" #>  - attr(*, "class")= chr [1:2] "nglayers" "list" # } # get a sample flywire neuroglancer scene sc=ngl_decode_scene(system.file("flywire-annotations.json" ,   package = 'fafbseg')) sc #> neuroglancer scene with 4 layers and 43 segments (of which 1 shown) #>                                 name                    type visible nsegs #> 1                   Production-image                   image    TRUE     0 #> 2 Production-segmentation_with_graph segmentation_with_graph    TRUE     1 #> 3                         annotation              annotation    TRUE     0 #> 4                     jfrc_mesh_test            segmentation   FALSE     1 #>   nhidden #> 1       0 #> 2      42 #> 3       0 #> 4       1 #>                                                                        source #> 1 precomputed://gs://microns-seunglab/drosophila_v0/alignment/image_rechunked #> 2          graphene://https://prodv1.flywire-daf.com/segmentation/1.0/fly_v31 #> 3                                                                        <NA> #> 4             precomputed://https://spine.itanna.io/files/eric/jfrc_mesh_test # save a copy sc.orig <- sc # remove a layer ngl_layers(sc)=ngl_layers(sc)[-3] # or using convenient - notation sc.noann <- sc.orig - "annotation"  # reverse layer order ngl_layers(sc)=ngl_layers(sc)[2:1]  # keep visible only ngl_layers(sc) <- ngl_layers(sc, visible) # visible + multiple segments ngl_layers(sc) <- ngl_layers(sc, visible & nsegs>0) # flywire segmentation ngl_layers(sc) <- ngl_layers(sc, type=="segmentation_with_graph")  # combine layers using + convenience method sc.noann + ngl_layers(sc.orig)['annotation'] #> neuroglancer scene with 4 layers and 43 segments (of which 1 shown) #>                                 name                    type visible nsegs #> 1                   Production-image                   image    TRUE     0 #> 2 Production-segmentation_with_graph segmentation_with_graph    TRUE     1 #> 3                     jfrc_mesh_test            segmentation   FALSE     1 #> 4                         annotation              annotation    TRUE     0 #>   nhidden #> 1       0 #> 2      42 #> 3       1 #> 4       0 #>                                                                        source #> 1 precomputed://gs://microns-seunglab/drosophila_v0/alignment/image_rechunked #> 2          graphene://https://prodv1.flywire-daf.com/segmentation/1.0/fly_v31 #> 3             precomputed://https://spine.itanna.io/files/eric/jfrc_mesh_test #> 4                                                                        <NA> if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # combine layers from two scenes ngl_layers(sc) <- c(ngl_layers(sc), ngl_layers(sc2)) ngl_layers(sc) <- c(ngl_layers(sc)[-(3:4)], ngl_layers(sc2)[3:4]) ngl_layers(sc) <- c(ngl_layers(sc), ngl_layers(sc2)[-1]) ngl_layers(sc) <- c(ngl_layers(sc), ngl_layers(sc2)['annotation']) sc  # another way to add a single scene ngl_layers(sc)[[4]] <- ngl_layers(sc2)[[4]]  # add a new layer to a scene by parsing some JSON from the clipboard # note the double brackets are essential here ngl_layers(sc)[['jfrc_mesh']] <- jsonlite::fromJSON(clipr::read_clip()) } # }

what: Helper function to turn diverse inputs into neuroglancer segment ids — ngl_segments
title: Helper function to turn diverse inputs into neuroglancer segment ids — ngl_segments

title: Helper function to turn diverse inputs into neuroglancer segment ids — ngl_segments
code: ngl_segments(   x,   as_character = TRUE,   include_hidden = FALSE,   must_work = TRUE,   unique = FALSE,   ... )  ngl_segments(x) <- value

title: Helper function to turn diverse inputs into neuroglancer segment ids — ngl_segments
text: x Neuroglancer ids either vector ids (character vector integer64 recommended) scene specification raw JSON. format (character vector), path file disk, neuroglancer scene URL (embeds JSON scene specification single URL), R list generated parsing one . as_character Whether return segments character rather numeric vector (default character safety). include_hidden Whether include hiddenSegments (typically flywire scenes). must_work TRUE, default, error generated scene segments invalid ids present. Explicit NAs trigger error must_work=T, returned id 0 without error must_work=F. unique TRUE drops duplicated ids warning ... Additional arguments passed ngl_decode_scene value Segment ids form understandable ngl_segments. can include character/numeric/int64 ids, URL, parsed neuroglancer scene etc.

title: Helper function to turn diverse inputs into neuroglancer segment ids — ngl_segments
text: Numeric (character) vector segment ids, taken first   segmentation layer (warning) scene contains one.

title: Helper function to turn diverse inputs into neuroglancer segment ids — ngl_segments
text: simple vector inputs, ngl_segments treat values   "NA", "NAN", "NULL" (case insensitive) "" NA. ngl_segments<- chooses FlyWire style   segmentation_with_graph layer exists otherwise first   visible segmentation layer. Note hiddenSegment removed   process.

title: Helper function to turn diverse inputs into neuroglancer segment ids — ngl_segments
code: # -> character ngl_segments(c(10950626347, 10952282491, 13307888342)) #> [1] "10950626347" "10952282491" "13307888342" # turns these into numeric ngl_segments(c("10950626347", "10952282491", "13307888342"), as_character=FALSE) #> [1] 10950626347 10952282491 13307888342  # \donttest{ u="https://ngl.flywire.ai/?json_url=https://globalv1.flywire-daf.com/nglstate/5409525645443072" ngl_segments(u, as_character = TRUE) #> [1] "720575940621039145" "720575940626877799" sc=ngl_decode_scene(u) # set segments ngl_segments(sc) <- c("720575940621039145") # or a shortcut to add ids sc=sc+c("720575940621039145", "720575940626877799") sc #> neuroglancer scene with 2 layers and 2 segments (of which 2 shown) #>                                 name                    type visible nsegs #> 1                   Production-image                   image    TRUE     0 #> 2 Production-segmentation_with_graph segmentation_with_graph    TRUE     2 #>   nhidden #> 1       0 #> 2       0 #>                                                                        source #> 1 precomputed://gs://microns-seunglab/drosophila_v0/alignment/image_rechunked #> 2          graphene://https://prodv1.flywire-daf.com/segmentation/1.0/fly_v31 if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # paste resultant URL to clipboard to use in neuroglancer clipr::write_clip(as.character(sc)) } # }  # you can also modify the URL directly ngl_segments(u)=c("720575940621039145", "720575940626877799") # }  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ browseURL(u)  ## Summary of different classes of input # from clipboard ngl_segments(clipr::read_clip()) # URL ngl_segments("<ngl-scene-url>") # path to file on disk ngl_segments("/path/to/scene.json") # R list ngl_segments(scenelist) } # }

title: Construct Neuroglancer URL based on 3D location data — open_fafb_ngl
code: open_fafb_ngl(   x,   s = rgl::select3d(),   zoomFactor = 8,   coords.only = FALSE,   open = interactive() && !coords.only,   sample = NULL,   reference = NULL,   sampleurl = NULL,   ... )

title: Construct Neuroglancer URL based on 3D location data — open_fafb_ngl
text: x numeric vector object compatible xyzmatrix CATMAID URL (see details) s Optional selection function type returned select3d zoomFactor Neuroglancer zoomFactor (bigger means zoomed ) coords.Return raw coordinate string pasting Neuroglancer position widget (top left screen) open Whether open URL browser - defaults TRUE interactive use. sample, reference Template space input object sample target (reference). See examples xform_brain details specified. sampleurl sample URL defines Neuroglancer dataset. ... Additional arguments passed fromJSON control JSON parsing.

title: Construct Neuroglancer URL based on 3D location data — open_fafb_ngl
text: character vector Neuroglancer URL coordinate string   (invisibly open=TRUE)

title: Construct Neuroglancer URL based on 3D location data — open_fafb_ngl
text: Neuroglancer scenes seem specified single URL   encodes json object defining layers display, position etc.   function works taking sample URL defining scene   editing point new 3D location / adjust zoom. package comes 4 different default scene urls specified via   choose_segmentation with_segmentation.   easiest way choose particular segmentation. can also   specify different sample URL via sampleurl argument;   remembered rest R session. regularly use   particular kind scene URL, can set options(fafbseg.sampleurl)   Rprofile file.

title: Construct Neuroglancer URL based on 3D location data — open_fafb_ngl
code: u=paste0("https://fafb.catmaid.virtualflybrain.org/?pid=2&zp=131280&", "yp=170014.98879622458&xp=426584.81386896875&tool=navigator&sid0=2&s0=-1")  # translate URL but don't open browser open_fafb_ngl(u, open=FALSE) #> [1] "https://ngl.flywire.ai/#!%7B%22layers%22%3A%5B%7B%22source%22%3A%22precomputed%3A%2F%2Fgs%3A%2F%2Fmicrons-seunglab%2Fdrosophila_v0%2Falignment%2Fimage_rechunked%22%2C%22type%22%3A%22image%22%2C%22blend%22%3A%22default%22%2C%22shaderControls%22%3A%7B%7D%2C%22name%22%3A%22Production-image%22%7D%2C%7B%22source%22%3A%22graphene%3A%2F%2Fhttps%3A%2F%2Fprod.flywire-daf.com%2Fsegmentation%2Ftable%2Ffly_v31%22%2C%22type%22%3A%22segmentation_with_graph%22%2C%22segments%22%3A%5B%220%22%5D%2C%22skeletonRendering%22%3A%7B%22mode2d%22%3A%22lines_and_points%22%2C%22mode3d%22%3A%22lines%22%7D%2C%22graphOperationMarker%22%3A%5B%7B%22annotations%22%3A%5B%5D%2C%22tags%22%3A%5B%5D%7D%2C%7B%22annotations%22%3A%5B%5D%2C%22tags%22%3A%5B%5D%7D%5D%2C%22pathFinder%22%3A%7B%22color%22%3A%22%23ffff00%22%2C%22pathObject%22%3A%7B%22annotationPath%22%3A%7B%22annotations%22%3A%5B%5D%2C%22tags%22%3A%5B%5D%7D%2C%22hasPath%22%3Afalse%7D%7D%2C%22name%22%3A%22Production-segmentation_with_graph%22%7D%5D%2C%22navigation%22%3A%7B%22pose%22%3A%7B%22position%22%3A%7B%22voxelSize%22%3A%5B4%2C4%2C40%5D%2C%22voxelCoordinates%22%3A%5B106646.2035%2C42503.7472%2C3282%5D%7D%7D%2C%22zoomFactor%22%3A8%7D%2C%22perspectiveZoom%22%3A2230.6094%2C%22jsonStateServer%22%3A%22https%3A%2F%2Fglobalv1.flywire-daf.com%2Fnglstate%2Fpost%22%2C%22selectedLayer%22%3A%7B%22layer%22%3A%22Production-segmentation_with_graph%22%2C%22visible%22%3Atrue%7D%2C%22layout%22%3A%22xy-3d%22%7D"  # produce an x,y,z string to paste into Neuroglancer open_fafb_ngl(u, coords.only=TRUE) #> [1] "106646.203467242,42503.7471990561,3282"  # translate URL converting from FAFB14 to FlyWire coordinates # (only a small shift) open_fafb_ngl(u, sample="FAFB14", reference="FlyWire", open=FALSE) #> [1] "https://ngl.flywire.ai/#!%7B%22layers%22%3A%5B%7B%22source%22%3A%22precomputed%3A%2F%2Fgs%3A%2F%2Fmicrons-seunglab%2Fdrosophila_v0%2Falignment%2Fimage_rechunked%22%2C%22type%22%3A%22image%22%2C%22blend%22%3A%22default%22%2C%22shaderControls%22%3A%7B%7D%2C%22name%22%3A%22Production-image%22%7D%2C%7B%22source%22%3A%22graphene%3A%2F%2Fhttps%3A%2F%2Fprod.flywire-daf.com%2Fsegmentation%2Ftable%2Ffly_v31%22%2C%22type%22%3A%22segmentation_with_graph%22%2C%22segments%22%3A%5B%220%22%5D%2C%22skeletonRendering%22%3A%7B%22mode2d%22%3A%22lines_and_points%22%2C%22mode3d%22%3A%22lines%22%7D%2C%22graphOperationMarker%22%3A%5B%7B%22annotations%22%3A%5B%5D%2C%22tags%22%3A%5B%5D%7D%2C%7B%22annotations%22%3A%5B%5D%2C%22tags%22%3A%5B%5D%7D%5D%2C%22pathFinder%22%3A%7B%22color%22%3A%22%23ffff00%22%2C%22pathObject%22%3A%7B%22annotationPath%22%3A%7B%22annotations%22%3A%5B%5D%2C%22tags%22%3A%5B%5D%7D%2C%22hasPath%22%3Afalse%7D%7D%2C%22name%22%3A%22Production-segmentation_with_graph%22%7D%5D%2C%22navigation%22%3A%7B%22pose%22%3A%7B%22position%22%3A%7B%22voxelSize%22%3A%5B4%2C4%2C40%5D%2C%22voxelCoordinates%22%3A%5B106560.9535%2C42529.9972%2C3282%5D%7D%7D%2C%22zoomFactor%22%3A8%7D%2C%22perspectiveZoom%22%3A2230.6094%2C%22jsonStateServer%22%3A%22https%3A%2F%2Fglobalv1.flywire-daf.com%2Fnglstate%2Fpost%22%2C%22selectedLayer%22%3A%7B%22layer%22%3A%22Production-segmentation_with_graph%22%2C%22visible%22%3Atrue%7D%2C%22layout%22%3A%22xy-3d%22%7D" if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # copy CATMAID URL from clipboard and Neuroglancer coords to clipboard clipr::write_clip(open_fafb_ngl(clipr::read_clip(), coords.only=TRUE))  # Open a location in MB peduncle with current preferred segmentation open_fafb_ngl(c(433440, 168344, 131200))  # choose a particular segmentation (Google FAFB) with_segmentation("20190805", open_fafb_ngl(c(433440, 168344, 131200), zoomFactor=2))  # or FlyWire with_segmentation("flywire", open_fafb_ngl(c(433440, 168344, 131200)))  # ... and translate FAFB14 to FlyWire coordinates with_segmentation("flywire", open_fafb_ngl(c(433440, 168344, 131200), sample="FAFB14", reference="FlyWire", zoomFactor=2))  # open a CATMAID URL in Neuroglancer open_fafb_ngl(u)  # Set an existing scene URL (pointing to any old location) to act as # the template for open_fafb_ngl # nb the package sets one for you on startup if you haven't set yourself options(fafbseg.sampleurl="https://<neuroglancerlurl>") # Edit your R profile if you want to set a different default usethis::edit_r_profile() } # }

OmitFailures=FALSE, "try-error" objects   left place. either last 2 cases error messages   printed call wrapped try(expr, silent=TRUE). optional dataframe (df) detailing neuron   rownames match names neuron. also make   sense key present column data frame.   dataframe contains rows neurons, superfluous rows dropped   warning. dataframe missing rows neurons error   generated. SortOnUpdate=TRUE updating existing   neuronlist result new neuronlist   ordering identical reading neurons scratch.

title: Read meshes from chunked graph (graphene) server via CloudVolume — save_cloudvolume_meshes
text: may use fetch meshes https://flywire.ai   among sources. may need select preferred remote data   source using choose_segmentation (see examples).   hood, uses   CloudVolume serverless   Python client reading data   Neuroglancer compatible   formats. therefore need working python3 install   CloudVolume. Please install Python CloudVolume module described :   https://github.com/seung-lab/cloud-volume#setup. must ensure   using python3 (implicitly explicitly) mesh fetching   graphene servers depends . normally work: pip3   install cloud-volume. already installed CloudVolume   found, recommend editing Renviron file set   environment variable pointing correct Python. can   usethis::edit_r_environ() setting e.g.   RETICULATE_PYTHON="/usr/local/bin/python3". normally need set kind authentication order   fetch data. flywire, recommend function   flywire_set_token. data sources details,   see https://github.com/seung-lab/cloud-volume#chunkedgraph-secretjson   get token save . can either save json   snippet ~/.cloudvolume/secrets/cave-secret.json set   environment variable (CHUNKEDGRAPH_SECRET="XXXX". Finally also need set option pointing server.   conveniently achieved using e.g.   choose_segmentation('flywire31'), now default,   sources without built-support, can also specify full source URL,   might look something like options(fafbseg.cloudvolume.url='graphene://https://xxx.dynamicannotationframework.com/segmentation/xxx/xxx') can easily add startup Rprofile   usethis::edit_r_profile().

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ kcmesh=save_cloudvolume_meshes("720575940623755722", savedir=".") kc=read.neurons(kcmesh) } # } if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # The very first time you access FlyWire data you need to get/store a token flywire_set_token()  # Each R session, you should choose the default segmentation you want choose_segmentation('flywire31') pmn1.flywire=read_cloudvolume_meshes("720575940623979522") pmn1.fafb=read.neuron.catmaid(5321581)  # Read and plot sample KCs from a FlyWire (short) URL u="https://ngl.flywire.ai/?json_url=https://globalv1.flywire-daf.com/nglstate/6230669436911616" kcs=read_cloudvolume_meshes(u) kcs plot3d(kcs)  nclear3d() plot3d(pmn1.fafb, col='red', lwd=2, WithNodes = F) wire3d(pmn1.flywire)  # you can select specific locations like so library(elmr) # CATMAID URL open_fafb(pmn1.flywire[[1]], open=F) # CATMAID coords to paste into PIN location box cat(xyzmatrix(catmaid::catmaid_parse_url(open_fafb(pmn1.flywire[[1]], open=F))), sep=',') # Neuroglancer coords (raw pixels not nm) open_fafb_ngl(pmn1.flywire[[1]], open=F, coords.only = T) } # }

title: Read L2 skeleton or dotprops for FlyWire data sources using fafbseg-py — read_l2skel
text: read_l2dp generally recommended rather fetching   skeleton calculating dotprops much faster also   computes better direction vectors. However wish simplify   skeleton (e.g. find cell body fibre) need take   two step approach. also possible advantage can   specify step size direction vectors generated along   neuron. Note also read_l2dp may drop regions neuron   (likely thin ones) define small mesh volume. functions depends Philipp Schlegel's fafbseg-py package.   can install using simple_python. datastack_name argument optional correct   datastack name corresponding cloud volume URL read options   set choose_segmentation; generally preferred   way end users select active dataset. Neverthless,   datastack_name used look correct segmentation   URL fafbseg-py correctly set using two pieces   information.

code: simple_python(   pyinstall = c("basic", "full", "extra", "cleanenv", "blast", "none"),   pkgs = NULL,   miniconda = TRUE )

title: Simple Python installation for use with R/fafbseg/FlyWire — simple_python
text: pyinstall Whether "basic" install (enough functionality) "full" install, includes tools accessing fast/simple skeletons "dotprops" NBLAST via fafbseg-py package; "extra" installs neuron packages enable high resolution skeletonisation really necessary users frankly pain install. "cleanenv" show clean Python environment removing packages. "blast" show completely remove dedicated miniconda installation. Choosing ="none" skips update/install Python recommended packages installing extras defined pkgs. pkgs Additional python packages install. miniconda Whether use reticulate package's default approach dedicated python R based miniconda (recommended, default) allow specification different system installed Python via RETICULATE_PYTHON environment variable.

title: Simple Python installation for use with R/fafbseg/FlyWire — simple_python
text: recommended Python install procedure installs miniconda Python   distribution. added system PATH default   can used exclusively R. want use miniconda,   least ) make Python virtual environment using virtualenv   (conda managing conda install) b) specify   Python want use RETICULATE_PYTHON environment   variable. can set RETICULATE_PYTHON   usethis::edit_r_environ(). decided stick miniconda recommended, customisation   still possible. halfway house, can set   options('fafbseg.condaenv') specify non-standard miniconda   virtual environment alternative default "r-reticulate".   Furthermore can set environment variable   RETICULATE_MINICONDA_PYTHON_VERSION=3.10 use newer version   Python reticulate package recommends. sounds complicated, strongly suggest sticking default   miniconda=TRUE approach. Note installing miniconda Python first time   updating miniconda install, likely asked restart R.   restart Python interpreter linked R   session. Therefore Python already running session, must   restart R use new Python install.

title: Simple Python installation for use with R/fafbseg/FlyWire — simple_python
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # just the basics simple_python("basic") # if you want to skeletonise meshes simple_python("full")  # To install a special package using the recommended approach simple_python(pkgs="PyChunkedGraph") # the same but without touching Python itself or the recommended packages simple_python('none', pkgs='PyChunkedGraph')  # install a specific version of cloud-volume package simple_python('none', pkgs='cloud-volume~=3.8.0') # if you really need to insist (e.g. because a newer version is already installed) reticulate::py_install('cloud-volume==8.15.0', pip = TRUE)  # install the latest version of a package from github simple_python('none', pkgs="git+git://github.com/schlegelp/skeletor@master")  # install a specific earlier version of a package simple_python('none', pkgs="git+git://github.com/seung-lab/DracoPy@v0.0.15")  # install all recommended packages but use your existing Python # only do this if you know what you are doing ... simple_python("full", miniconda=FALSE) } # }

what: Skeletonise neuron meshes using skeletor — skeletor
title: Skeletonise neuron meshes using skeletor — skeletor
text: can skeletonise complex neuron meshes using skeletor   skeletor-1.0.0. Skeletor   python library function wraps series skeletor functions   order smoothly process neurons use   natverse. Note, default settings optimise   performance fast skeletonisation   flywire meshes. casual users   recommend using 'wave' method, fast simple terms   parameters, .e. just uses waves step_size. value   1 often works well.

title: Skeletonise neuron meshes using skeletor — skeletor
code: skeletor(   segments = NULL,   obj = NULL,   mesh3d = FALSE,   save.obj = NULL,   cloudvolume.url = getOption("fafbseg.cloudvolume.url"),   operator = c("umbrella", "contangent"),   clean = FALSE,   remove_disconnected = 10,   theta = 0.01,   radius = TRUE,   ratio = 0.1,   SL = 10,   WH0 = 2,   iter_lim = 4,   epsilon = 0.05,   precision = 1e-06,   validate = TRUE,   method.radii = c("knn", "ray"),   method = c("wavefront", "vertex_clusters", "edge_collapse", "teasar", "tangent_ball"),   heal = TRUE,   heal.k = 10L,   heal.threshold = Inf,   reroot = TRUE,   k.soma.search = 10,   radius.soma.search = 2500,   brain = NULL,   n = 5,   n_rays = 20,   projection = c("sphere", "tangents"),   fallback = "knn",   waves = 2,   step_size = 1,   sampling_dist = 500,   cluster_pos = c("median", "center"),   shape_weight = 1,   sample_weight = 0.1,   inv_dist = 100,   cpu = Inf,   elapsed = Inf,   ... )  reroot_hairball(x, k.soma.search = 10, radius.soma.search = 2500, brain = NULL)  download_neuron_obj(   segments,   save.obj = getwd(),   ratio = 1,   cloudvolume.url = getOption("fafbseg.cloudvolume.url"),   ... )

title: Skeletonise neuron meshes using skeletor — skeletor
text: segments segment ids fetch (probably character vector), e.g. flywire IDs hemibrain bodyids. Meshes read specified CloudVolume (cloudvolume.url). obj character. Path obj file folder files. files read meshes skeletonised. segments given, argument overridden. mesh3d logical. TRUE neuron's volume added neuron object resultant neuronlist] neuron$mesh3d. save.obj character. Path save .obj file neuron volumes. NULL, .obj files saved (default). cloudvolume.url Optional url fetch meshes normally specified fafbseg.cloudvolume.url option. operator Laplacian operator use mesh contraction. "contangent" takes topology geometry mesh account better descriptor curvature flow. "umbrella", 'uniform weighting' operator uses topological features, making robust mesh flaws. clean logical. TRUE , python, skeletor.post.clean_up used collapse twigs line sight move nodes outside mesh back inside. Note magic bullet work (well) original mesh degenerate (e.g. internal faces watertight) begin . need ncollpyde python3 module installed. can get pip3 install ncollpyde. get issues related module, best set FALSE. skeletor.pre.fix_mesh also used remove seemingly erroneous vertices remove common mesh problems. remove_disconnected, integer 'False'. number given clean==TRUE,\ iterate mesh's connected components remove consisting less given number vertices. example, “remove_fragments=5“ drop parts mesh consist five less connected vertices. theta numeric. Used clean=TRUE. twig generate dot product tangent vectors parents. line perfectly dot product equal 1. theta determines much value can differ 1 us still prune twig: higher theta = pruning. radius logical. Whether return radius information skeleton node. want make use radii, need ncollpyde python3 module installed. can get pip3 install ncollpyde. get issues related module, best set FALSE. ratio numeric, 0-1. Factor reduce mesh faces. example, ratio 0.5 reduce number faces 50 percent. SL numeric. Factor contraction matrix multiplied iteration. theory, lower values likely get optimal contraction cost needing iterations. WH0 numeric. Initial weight factor attraction constraints. ratio initial weights WL0 (1e-3 * sqrt()) WH0 controls smoothness degree contraction first iteration result, thus determines amount details retained subsequent final contracted meshes. iter_lim integer. Maximum rounds contractions. epsilon numeric. Target contraction rate measured sum face areas contracted versus original mesh. Algorithm stop mesh contracted threshold. Depending mesh (number faces, shape) reaching strong contraction can extremely costly comparatively little benefit subsequent skeletonisation. Note algorithm might stop short target iter_lim reached first sum face areas increasing one iteration next instead decreasing. precision numeric. Sets precision finding least-square solution. main determinant speed vs quality: lower values take (much) longer get closer optimally contracted mesh. Higher values faster iterative contractions might stop early. validate True, try fix potential issues mesh (e.g. infinite values, duplicate vertices, degenerate faces) collapsing. Degenerate meshes can lead effectively infinite runtime function! method.radii method determine node's radius. "knn" uses k-nearest-neighbours get radii: fast potential wrong. "ray" uses ray-casting get radii: slower sometimes less wrong. method Skeletonisation comes two flavours different Pros Cons. "vertex_clusters" groups collapses vertices based geodesic distance along mesh's surface. fast scales well can lead oversimplification. Good quick & dirty skeletonisations. "edge_collapse" implements skeleton extraction edge collapse described Au et al. 2008. rather slow scale well really good preserving topology. heal logical. Whether , neuron id fragmented, stitch multiple fragments single neuron using minimum spanning tree. heal.k integer. number nearest neighbours consider trying merge different clusters. heal.threshold numeric. threshold distance new vertices connected (default=Inf disables feature). parameter prevents merging vertices far away main neuron likely spurious. reroot logical. Whether re-root neuron estimated 'soma'. soma usually large ball neuron, skeletonise something hair ball. can try detect quickly reroot skeleton . finding nearest leaf nodes leaf node, seeing going divergent directions. k.soma.search integer. number leaf nodes find, around leaf node radius radius.soma.search, rerooting process. larger number, better slower. radius.soma.search numeric. distance within search fellow leaf nodes rerooting process. inaccurate values high low. size expected soma. brain mesh3d hxsurf object within soma occur. re-rooting process. (Insect somata tend lie outside brain proper) n method.radii = "knn". Radius mean n nearest-neighbours. n_rays integer. method.radii = "knn".method.radii = "ray". Number rays cast node. projection method.radii = "ray". Whether cast rays sphere around node circle orthogonally node's tangent vector. fallback method.radii = "ray". point outside right surface mesh ray casting return nonsense results. can either ignore cases ("None"), assign arbitrary number can fall back radii k-nearest-neighbours ("knn"). waves integer. method = "wavefront". Number waves run across mesh. wave initialised different vertex produces slightly different rings. final skeleton produced mean across waves. waves produce higher resolution skeletons also introduce noise. step_size integer, Values greater 1 effectively lead binning rings. example stepsize 2 means two adjacent vertex rings collapsed center. can help reduce noise skeleton (counteracts large number waves) sampling_dist numeric. method = "vertex_clusters". Maximal distance vertices clustered. parameter tuned based resolution mesh. cluster_pos numeric. method = "vertex_clusters". determine x/y/z coordinates collapsed vertex clusters (.e. skeleton's nodes). "median": Use vertex closest cluster's centrer mass. "center": Use center mass. makes smoother skeletons can lead nodes outside mesh. shape_weight numeric. method = "edge_collapse". Weight shape costs penalize collapsing edges drastically change shape object. sample_weight numeric.method = "edge_collapse". Weight sampling costs penalise collapses generate prohibitively long edges. inv_dist numeric.method = "teasar". Distance along mesh used invalidation vertices. controls detailed (noisy) skeleton . cpu double (length one). Set limit total cpu time seconds. elapsed double (length one). Set limit total elapsed cpu time seconds ... Additional arguments passed reticulate::py_run_string. x nat::neuron object.

title: Skeletonise neuron meshes using skeletor — skeletor
text: nat::neuronlist containing neuron skeleton objects.

title: Skeletonise neuron meshes using skeletor — skeletor
text: pipeline: 1. Reads specified meshes CloudVolume source. 2. Simplifies mesh (python: skeletor.pre.simplify) 3. Contract mesh (python: skeletor.pre.contract) 4. Skeletonises mesh (python: skeletor.skeletonize) 5. Optionally, cleans mesh (python: skeletor.post.clean_up) 6. Optionally, add radius information skeleton (python:   skeletor.post.radii) 7. Optionally, heal skeleton breaks   (nat::stitch_neurons_mst) 8. Optionally, attempts re-root neuron 'hairball', .e.   approximate soma (reroot_hairball). therefore need working python3 install skeletor,   uses CloudVolume. require meshparty. Please install   Python skeletor module described :   https://github.com/schlegelp/skeletor. must ensure   using python3 (implicitly explicitly) mesh fetching graphene   servers depends . normally work: pip3 install   git+git://github.com/schlegelp/skeletor@master. already   installed skeletor found, recommend editing   Renviron file set environment variable pointing   correct Python. can usethis::edit_r_environ()   setting e.g. RETICULATE_PYTHON="/usr/local/bin/python3".   (Though best practice create conda environment   natverse R sessions direct R using environ file.) need set kind authentication order fetch   volume data skeletonisation. See   https://github.com/seung-lab/cloud-volume#chunkedgraph-secretjson   get token save . can either save json snippet   ~/.cloudvolume/secrets/cave-secret.json set   environment variable (CHUNKEDGRAPH_SECRET="XXXX". Finally also need set option pointing server.   server hosting mesh data interested . might look   something like:   options(fafbseg.cloudvolume.url='graphene://https://xxx.dynamicannotationframework.com/segmentation/xxx/xxx')    can easily add startup Rprofile   usethis::edit_r_profile(). example, flywire data set,   currently:   'graphene://https://prodv1.flywire-daf.com/segmentation/1.0/fly_v31'. Roughly decreasing order impact speed: Ratio: lower ratio = less vertices = faster epsilon: lower target contraction rate = less steps = faster SL: faster contraction = pot. less steps target contraction rate =   faster precision: lower precision = faster least-square computation = faster sampling_dist: larger dist = faster collapse mesh skeleton = faster

title: Add a transformation to one or more layers in a neuroglancer scene — xform.ngscene
code: # \donttest{ # flywire scene u='https://ngl.flywire.ai/?json_url=https://globalv1.flywire-daf.com/nglstate/4559706743898112' scf=ngl_decode_scene(u) m=matrix(c(-0.9663, -0.0695, 0.17, 0, 0.0351, 1.043, -0.028, 0, 0.1082,   -0.0093, 0.9924, 0, 1021757.1284, 31409.0911, -85626.0572, 1), ncol=4) # nb replaces existing layer of this name xform(scf, m, layers=c('Production-mirrored')) #> neuroglancer scene with 4 layers and 1 segments (of which 1 shown) #>                   name                    type visible nsegs nhidden #> 1       Maryland-image                   image    TRUE     0       0 #> 2           Production segmentation_with_graph    TRUE     1       0 #> 3  Production-mirrored segmentation_with_graph    TRUE     1       0 #> 4 brain_mesh_v141.surf            segmentation    TRUE     1       0 #>                                                                           source #> 1        precomputed://https://bossdb-open-data.s3.amazonaws.com/flywire/fafbv14 #> 2             graphene://https://prodv1.flywire-daf.com/segmentation/1.0/fly_v31 #> 3             graphene://https://prodv1.flywire-daf.com/segmentation/1.0/fly_v31 #> 4 precomputed://gs://flywire_neuropil_meshes/whole_neuropil/brain_mesh_v141.surf  scu=ngl_decode_scene('https://tinyurl.com/kj9rwn26') # make a new layer mirroring an existing layer scu2=xform(scu, m, layers=c('fly_v31_m'='fly_v31')) scu2 #> neuroglancer scene with 4 layers and 2 segments (of which 2 shown) #>              name         type visible nsegs nhidden #> 1              v1        image    TRUE     0       0 #> 2         fly_v31 segmentation    TRUE     2       0 #> 3 jfrc_mesh_test1 segmentation   FALSE     1       0 #> 4       fly_v31_m segmentation    TRUE     2       0 #>                                                                        source #> 1                                    precomputed://gs://flywire_em/aligned/v1 #> 2 graphene://middleauth+https://prod.flywire-daf.com/segmentation/1.0/fly_v31 #> 3             precomputed://https://spine.itanna.io/files/eric/jfrc_mesh_test #> 4 graphene://middleauth+https://prod.flywire-daf.com/segmentation/1.0/fly_v31 # } if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ browseURL(as.character(scu2)) } # }  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # mirror a flywire scene based on points from a specific pair of neurons mbon18.dps=read_l2dp('MBON18') mirror_reg=fit_xform(samplepts = mbon18.dps,   refpts = nat.jrcbrains::mirror_fafb(mbon18.dps), subsample = 500) flywire_scene('MBON18') %>%   ngl_decode_scene %>%   xform(mirror_reg, layers=c("mirror"="Production-segmentation_with_graph")) %>%   as.character() %>%   browseURL() } # }

title: fafbseg 0.9.3 (pre-release version)
text: pre-release without full release notes, principally support new dependant package, fancr. new flywire_scene() function simple specification flywire neuroglancer scenes. add number features allow programmatic manipulation neuroglancer scenes. includes ngl_segments<-() replace segments scene +.ngscene() -.ngscene() add remove segments scene .character.ngscene() convert scene object URL. See examples ngl_segments() ngl_decode_scene() details (#55, #58). update flywire_set_token() support new cave zetta tokens (FANC dataset) (#119) expose chunkedgraph_token() function (#119) updates token handling handle FANC/FlyWire (#121) Private function check_cloudvolume_reticulate now supports minimum version Handle 1 node neurons (#120) Basic support Python caveclient package. enables fetching range annotation data CAVE (Connectome Annotation Versioning Engine) API including position nuclei user annotations. One notable improvement rapid fetching synaptic partner information. implemented new method="cave" option flywire_partner_summary() (#122). https://github.com/natverse/fafbseg/issues?q=closed%3A2020-12-27..2021-09-20+

title: fafbseg 0.9
text: version change 0.9 reflects small potentially breaking changes user visible behaviour. particular ngl_segments() now returns character default (protect FlyWire ids, expressed 8 byte floating point values). Add flywire_latestid() function map (past) root id current root id. Specifically identifies neuron inheriting largest number super voxels object specified input root id. Support Google ffn1 20200412 segmentation (#14, #46) Make ngl_segments() return ids character vector, rather numeric, default. Also exclude hidden ids default (#50, #51). Allow ngl_segments() (flywire_*) fns accept URLs surface meshes. Previously cause error (#52) Fix ngl_encode_url() tested flywire scenes can parsed R converted back valid URLs can opened flywire.ai (#53) Add print.ngscene method summarise neuroglancer scenes console (#54) flywire_cloudvolume() enables improved low-level support flywire+cloudvolume (exposing reusable cloudvolume object) (#48) full list closed issues GitHub. # fafbseg 0.8.2 Much faster flywire_xyz2id() supervoxel id mapping using spine service (#44) Add new flywire_leaves() function find supervoxels neuron (#43) Fixing typos adding doi TEASAR (#41 @mmc46) Fixing 2 things overlay mesh+skeleton example (#40 @mmc46) Fix flywire_xyz2id eg doc ‘natverse flywire meshes’ returns error (#39) Output dr_fafbseg() points wrong token helper function (#38 @mmc46) can see full list closed issues GitHub.

title: fafbseg 0.8.1

Large speed flywire_rootid() (#37) Fix flywire_xyz2id() can actually find supervoxels (well root ids) (#37) function dr_fafbseg() give status update installation (#36) read_cloudvolume_meshes() can now accept flywire URLs (expanded necessary define segments download) can see full list closed issues GitHub.
